Class HuffmanTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • HuffmanTree

  • public class HuffmanTree
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HuffmanTree(int[] counts)
      constructs a Huffman Tree from an array containing information about the frequency of characters from a given text file
      HuffmanTree(java.util.Scanner input)
      constructs a Huffman tree given a scanner on the file containing the codes generated by using the Huffman Algorithm

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decode(BitInputStream input, java.io.PrintStream output, int eof)
      decodes a given file from its compressed form to the original
      void write(java.io.PrintStream output)
      writes the new encoding for all the characters in the file to be compressed to a text file will write the encoding along with the characters ASCII encoding to be used to decoded encoded file

        constructs a Huffman Tree from an array containing information about the frequency of characters from a given text file

        counts - Array containing the frequencies of all the characters within a file

      • HuffmanTree

        public HuffmanTree(java.util.Scanner input)
        constructs a Huffman tree given a scanner on the file containing the codes generated by using the Huffman Algorithm
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(java.io.PrintStream output)
        writes the new encoding for all the characters in the file to be compressed to a text file will write the encoding along with the characters ASCII encoding to be used to decoded encoded file
        Parameters:
        output - PrintStream used to write the encodings to a file

      • decode

        public void decode(BitInputStream input,
                   java.io.PrintStream output,
                   int eof)
        decodes a given file from its compressed form to the original
        Parameters:
        input - BitInputStream used to read the bits from an encoded file
        output - PrintStream used to write the decoded test to a file
        eof - representation of the end of file character used to determine stopping point
